column4: UPDATE 1-M&T Bank to buy People's United Financial in $7.6 bln deal
column6: Feb 22 (Reuters) - M&T Bank Corp has agreed to buy People’s United Financial Inc in an all-stock deal valued at about $7.6 billion, expanding its branch network and creating a regional bank with about $200 billion in assets.
column7: The combined bank will have a network of more than 1,100 branches and over 2,000 ATMs across 12 U.S. states, M&T Bank said in a statement on Monday.
column8: Under the deal, People’s United shareholders will receive 0.118 shares of M&T common stock for each People’s United share they own. The offer implies a 13% premium to People’s United’s closing price on Friday.
column9: “The merger extends our reach by providing customers access to a larger banking network and an expanded array of services,” People’s United Chief Executive Officer Jack Barnes said.
column10: A loosening of financial regulations and lowering of corporate taxes under former U.S. President Donald Trump prompted regional lenders to pursue scale through deals.
column11: Spain’s BBVA agreed to sell its U.S. business to PNC Financial Services Group Inc for $11.6 billion in cash in one of the biggest global bank deals last year.
column12: Founded in 1842, People’s United Bank, a unit of People’s United Financial, offers commercial and retail banking services through a network of more than 400 retail locations.
column13: Buffalo, New York-headquartered M&T said it expects the deal to boost its earnings per share by 10-12% in 2023 while reducing annual costs by about $330 million.
column14: The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2021.
column15: Lazard acted as financial advisor to M&T, while Keefe, Bruyette & Woods served as lead financial advisor to People’s United. (Reporting by Noor Zainab Hussain in Bengaluru; Editing by Krishna Chandra Eluri and Aditya Soni)

column4: M&T Bank to buy People's United Financial in $7.6 billion deal
column5: (Reuters) - M&T Bank Corp said on Monday it agreed to buy People’s United Financial Inc in an all-stock deal valued at about $7.6 billion, creating a bank with about $200 billion in assets.

column4: M&T Bank may merge with People's United Financial in all-stock deal: WSJ
column5: (Reuters) - M&T Bank Corp is nearing an agreement to merge with People’s United Financial Inc, with the two companies discussing an all-stock deal that could be finalized as soon as this week, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.
column6: The banks will have more than $200 billion in assets combined, according to the report on.wsj.com/3qM0Z8c. People's United has a market value of about $6.6 billion, while M&T's is over $19 billion.
column7: The combined company is likely to be led by M&T Chief Executive René Jones and maintain a significant corporate presence in Bridgeport, the newspaper said.
column8: The companies did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment late on Sunday.
